payload.text:
Notre Dame University - Louaize (NDU)
Admission Guide 2025-2026
Accredited by NECHE (New England Commission of Higher Education)

metadata.heading: Notre Dame University - Louaize (NDU) Admission Guide 2025-2026

payload.text:
Internationally Accredited: NECHE accreditation and programmatic accreditation from leading bodies.
International Reach:
- 55+ Different Nationalities
- Over 24,000 alumni worldwide
Personal Support: Variety of financial support and personal mentoring.
MoUs: Agreements with multinational corporations and NGOs.
Inclusion: Initiatives promote diversity and offer tailored support. Contact: Office of Student Affairs, T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2047, E: sao@ndu.edu.lb
Washington D.C. Office: Advances NDU mission in the U.S.A., supports American Friends of NDU (AFNDU) chapters and alumni.
Three Campuses across Lebanon:
- Main Campus: Zouk Mosbeh
- North Lebanon Campus: Barsa, El Koura
- Shouf Campus: St. Abda Monastery, Deir El-Kamar

Student Activities:
- Over 30 student clubs and societies.
- NDU Model United Nations (MUN) program promotes diversity, respect, and leadership.
- Contact (Dept. of Student Activities): T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2348 | E: studentactivities@ndu.edu.lb
- Contact (MUN Office): T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2048 | E: mun@ndu.edu.lb

Sports:
- Multipurpose gym for fitness, martial arts, bodybuilding, dancing.
- Sports clubs: Basketball, Volleyball, Taekwondo, Aikido, Physical Fitness, Body Building, Tennis, Swimming, Soccer, Rugby, Futsal, Table Tennis, etc.
- Contact (Dept. of Athletics): T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2067 | E: athletics@ndu.edu.lb

Community Services:
- Partnerships with NGOs for community projects.
- Students plan, adopt, and complete projects with diverse skills.
- Contact (Dept. of Community Service and Awareness): T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2068 | E: csa@ndu.edu.lb

Housing:
- Safe, well-maintained, reasonably priced residence for NDU students at Main Campus.
- Services: Laundry, fully equipped kitchen, study room, TV room, internet access, full-time security.
- Contact (Student Housing): T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2998 | E: studenthousing@ndu.edu.lb

Medical & Counseling Services:
- University Counseling Services team available to all enrolled students.
- Contact (Medical House): T: 09 208 800 Ext. 2269 | E: medicalhouse@ndu.edu.lb

Students with Special Needs:
- SKILD-led Learning Accommodation Service (LAS) facilitates learning accommodations.
- Services: Support, accommodations, collaboration with faculty and administration.
- Contact (LAS Team): T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2987 | E: las@ndu.edu.lb

NDU Career Center:
- Empowers students and alumni for career decisions and job market navigation.
- Services: Career guidance, CV/cover letter/portfolio assistance, interview preparation, job search support, skill development workshops, personality tests, internship/networking opportunities, career fairs, job shadowing, company visits, career resources.
- Works with ~1,500 companies and 400+ alumni leaders.
- Contact: T: 09 208 000 Ext. 2050 | E: career@ndu.edu.lb

Undergraduate:
- Architecture (BArch) • : 172 cr.
- Fashion Design (BA): 102 cr.
- Graphic Design (BA) ○: 102 cr.
- Interior Design (BA) • : 136 cr.
- Musicology (BA): 99 cr.
Graduate:
- Design (MA): 36 cr.
- Sustainable Architecture (MA): 30 cr.
(Symbols: ▲ Main Campus only, • North Lebanon Campus, ○ Shouf Campus)

payload.text:
FAAD: Graphic Design (18 cr.), Photography (18 cr.)
FBAE: Accounting, Finance, Economics, Management, Marketing Mgt, Distribution & Logistics Mgt, Human Resources Mgt (15 cr. each), Food & Beverage Mgt (19 cr.), Hospitality Mgt (18 cr.), Events Mgt (16 cr.), Entrepreneurship (15 cr.)

FNAS: Geographic Info Systems, Mathematics, Physics (15 cr. each), Actuarial Sciences (18 cr.), Biology (17 cr.), Environmental Science (16 cr.)
FNHS: Nutrition (15 cr.), Food Safety & Quality Mgt (15 cr.)

1. Online Application: Complete at https://sis.ndu.edu.lb/iApply/
2. Fee: USD 30 (Pay online via USD credit card or in person at NDU).
3. Required Documents:
   - Officially issued secondary school grades (last three academic years).
   - Photocopy of National ID Card or Passport.
   - One recent passport-size photo.
   - Certified copy of Lebanese Baccalaureate Part II or its equivalent.
4. Entrance Exams / Standardized Tests: Sit for NDU Entrance Exams or submit scores for:
   - English Proficiency: SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing (EBRW), TOEFL, or IELTS.
   - Math Aptitude: SAT Math.
5. Exam Fees (if applicable): USD 30 per NDU test (English or Math). USD 50 for both. Fees are non-refundable.
6. Document Submission: Must be original certified copies. Submitted documents become NDU property.

All applicants must demonstrate English proficiency. NDU recognizes EET, TOEFL, SAT EBRW, or IELTS.

EET Score Ranges:
- 60 and above: Accepted, ENL 213 (Sophomore Level)
- 55-59: Accepted, ENL 110 (3 credits - Remedial)
- 50-54: Accepted, ENL 105¹ (3 credits - Remedial)
- 40-49: Accepted, ENL 002² (9 credits - Intensive)

SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing Score Ranges:
- 540 and above: Accepted, ENL 213 (Sophomore Level)
- 490-530: Accepted, ENL 110 (3 credits - Remedial)
- 430-480: Accepted, ENL 105¹ (3 credits - Remedial)
- 400-420: Accepted, ENL 002² (9 credits - Intensive)

TOEFL iBT Score Ranges:
- 91 and above: Accepted, ENL 213 (Sophomore Level)
- 79-90: Accepted, ENL 110 (3 credits - Remedial)
- 69-78: Accepted, ENL 105¹ (3 credits - Remedial)
- 54-68: Accepted, ENL 002² (9 credits - Intensive)

IELTS Score Ranges:
- 6.5 and above: Accepted, ENL 213 (Sophomore Level)
- 6: Accepted, ENL 110 (3 credits - Remedial)
- 5.5: Accepted, ENL 105¹ (3 credits - Remedial)
- 5: Accepted, ENL 002² (9 credits - Intensive)

Notes:
¹ Any student enrolled in ENL 105, who scores a 'B' or above, will automatically pass to ENL 213.
² Any student enrolled in ENL 002, who scores a 'B' or above, will automatically pass to ENL 110.
Students are advised to take/repeat tests to improve scores and reduce remedial courses.

Freshman Students:
- Submit: Official school attestation/diploma (certified), Written Authorization from Lebanese Ministry of Education (for foreign program basis), SAT Scores (upon submission).
- Note: Requires 30 Freshman level credits. Science track allows any major; Arts track allows any major except Engineering & Computer Science.
- Required SAT Scores: Freshman Arts: 870 | Freshman Sciences: 950 (EBRW + Math).

Transfer Students:
- Submit: Official transcript of undergraduate record, Copy of undergraduate course descriptions (certified by university).
- Note for International Transfers: Certify official transcript at relevant country's Embassy in Lebanon AND Lebanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

- North Lebanon Campus: Tuesday, April 29, 2025

NDU offers Financial Aid Upon Admission, Scholarships Upon Admission, Sports Grant, and Sibling Grant. Highest percentage chosen if eligible for multiple.

Scholarships upon Admission:
- Awarded for good scores on SAT or Lebanese/French/International/Technical Baccalaureate.
- Automatically given upon score submission.

Sports Grant:
- 10% for joining NDU sports team.
- Additional 5% if team wins tournament/championship.
- 20% discount for NDU athletes on first division/national teams.
- Can be combined with other Financial Aid/Scholarship.
- Elite players: 50% Sports Scouting Scholarship (first year).

Sibling Grant:
- Family discount for two or more siblings enrolled simultaneously (from first semester).
- To Apply: Access Financial Aid on SIS, click Sibling Grant, add sibling's ID. Submit Family Status Record (not older than one year) to Dept. of Financial Aid.

metadata.heading: Scholarships & Financial Aid
keywords: how to apply for sibling grant

payload.text:
Process for Financial Aid upon Admission:
1. Check Online Acceptance Results: https://sis.ndu.edu.lb/OAR/
2. Fill out Financial Aid application online with one parent (ensure completion).
3. Schedule online appointment for interview with Dept. of Financial Aid.
4. Attend interview (approx. 45 mins) with at least one parent.
5. Print application, have it signed by self and parent.
6. Submit signed application & required documents in person during interview.

Deadlines for submission:
- Fall Semester: End of June
- Spring Semester: End of November

Contact: Department of Financial Aid - financialaid@ndu.edu.lb
Note: Timely completion is crucial. Delay may impact aid.

metadata.heading: Applying for Financial Aid upon Admission
